wikipedia_page.main: Thomas McCue (23 September 1913 – 19 April 1994) was an English professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1930s and 1940s. He played at representative level for Great Britain (vice-captain 1946 Great Britain Lions tour), England and Lancashire, and at club level for Widnes, Oldham RLFC (Heritage № 377) (World War II guest), Warrington (Heritage № 454) (World War II guest), Halifax (Heritage № 481) (World War II guest), Castleford (Heritage № 230) (World War II guest) and St Helens (Heritage № 621) (World War II guest), as a scrum-half, i.e. number 7.
